Package housewifei

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • housewifei.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Server Object Controls the house automation. Needs to be connected to Controllers, and listens to a ServerNotifier.
    Author:
    Alexe Simon and Mawait Maxime

    • Constructor Summary

      Server​(int number_of_pins)
      Default constructor with number of pin.
      Server​(java.lang.String config_file_pins, java.lang.String config_file_rules)
      Future final controller with config files as input.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server​(int number_of_pins)
        Default constructor with number of pin. Automatically instantiate a ServerNotifier. Use with connectController(int, Controller)
        Parameters:
        number_of_pins - The number of pin this server has.

      • Server

        public Server​(java.lang.String config_file_pins,
              java.lang.String config_file_rules)
        Future final controller with config files as input. Not yet implemented.
        Parameters:
        config_file_pins -
        config_file_rules -

    • Method Detail

      • connectController

        public void connectController​(int pin,
                              Controller controller)
        Manually add a controller to the list and adds the ServerNotifier to it.
        Parameters:
        pin - The pin this controller is connected to. Must not be in use.
        controller - The controller to be connected.

      • startController

        public void startController​(int pin)
        Starts a single controller on a certain pin.
        Parameters:
        pin - The pin the controller is connected to.

      • stopController

        public void stopController​(int pin)
        Stops a single controller on a certain pin.
        Parameters:
        pin - The pin the controller is connected to.

      • startAllControllers

        public void startAllControllers()
        Starts all controllers connected to this server.

      • stopAllControllers

        public void stopAllControllers()
        Gracefully stops all controllers connected to this server.

      • getEventListener

        public ServerNotifier getEventListener()
        Returns the ServerNotifier for this server.
        Returns:
        The ServerNotifier this server is listening to.

      • setEventListener

        public void setEventListener​(ServerNotifier eventListener)
        Sets the ServerNotifier for this server. Does not update any supposedly connected controller.
        Parameters:
        eventListener - The ServerNotifier this server must listen to.

      • checkHardCodedRules

        public void checkHardCodedRules()
        Some hard coded rules for demonstration of the correct server-controllers thread implementation.

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
        Starts the server.

      • stopServer

        public void stopServer()
        Gracefully stops the server.

      • run

        public void run()
        Generic thread function for a server. Uses checkHardCodedRules() for demonstration.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
